CIPHER.177.cipherString: A good friend can tell you what is the matter with you in a minute. He may not seem such a good friend after telling.
CIPHER.177.question: A quote from Arthur Brisbane has been encoded as an Aristocrat, what does it say?

CIPHER.187.cipherString: It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it.
CIPHER.187.question: Lou Holtz offers some advice that has been encoded using the Vigenère cipher with the keyword WORK.

CIPHER.178.cipherString: Save more than you spend, but do not hoard. Reinvest. Grow. Focus on replowing your fields so they bear fruit.
CIPHER.178.question: Solve this Aristocrat of a quote by Jennifer Ritchie Payette .   It has the word GROW somewhere in it.

CIPHER.189.cipherString: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.
CIPHER.189.question: A quote by Neil Gaiman has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=●●, 3=●×, 4=×–, 5=●–, 7=–●, 9=––

CIPHER.184.cipherString: There is nothing in the path of life that we don't already know before we start. Nothing is learned; it is simply remembered.
CIPHER.184.question: Carlos Ruiz Zafón expressed their opinion on life which has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  It ends with "REMEMBERED"

CIPHER.180.cipherString: There are some choices you can only make once. You can't go back to where you made a choice and then take the other one.
CIPHER.180.question: This phrase by Mary Hoffman has been encoded using a Caesar cipher.  What does it say?

CIPHER.181.cipherString: I was halfway across America, at the dividing line between the East of my youth and the West of my future.
CIPHER.181.question: A quote by Jack Kerouac has been encoded as an Aristocrat where you will find the word "THE" in it three times.

CIPHER.188.cipherString: Life is a mighty joke that is not meant to be funny.
CIPHER.188.question: These strange headlines are a Baconian cipher of a quote by Janvier Chouteu-Chando.  It starts out as LIFE I.

CIPHER.179.cipherString: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
CIPHER.179.question: Henry David Thoreau said the following which has been encoded using the Atbash cipher.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.192.cipherString: Acquiring wisdom is great but it is not the goal, applying it is.
CIPHER.192.question: A quote by Idowu Koyenikan has been encoded with the Vigenère cipher using a keyword of QUERY.  What was it?

CIPHER.195.cipherString: That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet.
CIPHER.195.question: A quote by the author Jhumpa Lahiri has been encoded using the Rail Fence Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 4 rails were used to encode it.

CIPHER.191.cipherString: Nuestro mundo interior es el templo más grande y la belleza natural más grande, hay que reconocerlo para que sea precioso.
CIPHER.191.question: A quote by Venugopala C.V.  has been translated into Spanish and then encoded as an Aristocrat with a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.  What does it say?
CIPHER.191.translation: Our Inner World is the greatest temple and the greatest natural beauty, one has to recognize it to make it precious

CIPHER.183.cipherString: The one who falls and gets up is stronger than the one who never tried. Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.
CIPHER.183.question: Roy T. Bennett provides some advice which has been encoded using a Caesar cipher.  What did he say?

CIPHER.190.cipherString: Hour battered suitcases whir piled on the sidewalk again; wee had longer weighs two go. But know madder, the rode is life.
CIPHER.190.question: Siri transcribed some thoughts by Jack Kerouac encrypted as an Aristocrat, unfortunately they misheard a bunch of the words.  What does it decrypt to say?

CIPHER.186.cipherString: I wonder, he said, whether the stars are set alight in heaven so that one day each one of us may find his own again...
CIPHER.186.question: A quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry has been encoded as an Aristocrat where you will find the word "ONE" in it two times.

CIPHER.193.cipherString: Who says life is fair, where is that written?
CIPHER.193.question: A quote by William Goldman has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=●, 2=–, 3=×, 4=●, 5=–, 6=×

CIPHER.182.cipherString: But what is life if you don't live it?
CIPHER.182.question: Decrypt this statement from James Patterson using the Affine cipher with a=5, and b=9

CIPHER.185.cipherString: Out of the fullness of the heart, the mouth speaks.
CIPHER.185.question: A statement by Chaucer has been encoded using a Baconian cipher.

CIPHER.194.cipherString: It is better to be respected than it is to be popular. Popularity ends on yearbook day, but respect lasts forever.
CIPHER.194.question: John Bytheway offers some advice that has been encoded using the Caesar cipher.  What does it decode to?
